content.description: A good beginner dihedral & crack route to develop trad climbing skills. Well protectable with good anchor options.
content.protection: Gear to 1", gear anchor. Descent: easy 5th class scrambleleft to escape.
content.location: The crack/dihedral to easier slab above

content.description:
This route was cleaned and listed here for young children to experience climbing in an easy atmosphere.

Steep eyebrow features low lead to easier climbing to join "Tots Crack" at the top of the pinnacle.
content.protection: TR, shared trad anchor. Easy 5th class scramble off left.
content.location: Just up-hill and left of "Tot's Crack".

content.description:
Pad past 2 bolts on a slab to a shallow dihedral, then transition right to a steep face.

Follow the weaknesses on big holds to a transition right to a face/arete finish with great exposure.

Well bolted and easy, with a second pitch coming soon - this is another nice moderate add to the Diamondback Area.
content.location: The next bolted route uphill from Phylanthropy.

content.description:
Long and varied. Start with a hand-jam below a steep face. Climb to a transition left & follow an easy slab back right to a short, steep face. A  thin slab finish leads to the anchors.

*There are several transitions (potential for rope drag), be aware of where the rope runs. Extendo draws help.

At the top of the slab w/the large boulder, flip your rope out of the crack before continuing up to reduce drag.
content.protection:
13 bolts, steel 'biner anchors.

Pull rope from right side of platform.
content.location:
The line of bolts just to the left of "Kidding Aside".

Belay from small platform on the left.

content.description:
Update: this route has been extended as of Jan 2021- 9 bolts to anchors.

Climb a short slab to a dihedral with pockets. Transition left to easier terrain to gain a steep pillowy headwall. Fun moves through  rounded bulges and holes lead to a steep wall. A transition right to face holds below the ledge keeps the grade reasonable, then step back left from the ledge on easier terrain to the anchors.
content.location: Just left of "Lithium Ranger", but transition left past the first optional bolt on the easy slab.

content.description:
Fun route with some long reaches between good holds.

Climb a blank-looking face (crux) to gain fun slots, knobs and eyebrows. Continue up & right on flakes, then transition onto a blocky arete.

Finish with fun moves through a bulge &  transition onto a slab.
content.location: The steep face above and left of the main Kidding Area. Scramble up to a rock platform and traverse right to start.
